Topic.Title: If you have not heard Windows Phone is going to be releasing Enterprise Apps and extending support.

Message.Msg: I have a friend who works for Microsoft and he was showing me how his Windows phone has MS Office on it: you can do Excel, Word, whatever. Now I don't know that I would WANT to do an elaborate worksheet on my wPhone, but it surer might be handy to have certain expense worksheet set so you can just type in data as you spend money. Also handy: I meet you by chance and can give you a quickie presentation right off my wPhone! WOW! THAT IS SNAZZY! And I can do full office off my SurfacePro and keep both in sink with my desk top & laptop! THIS IS WHERE THE BUSINESS WORLD IS GOING, GUYS! Buy Microsoft NOW while it is cheap!

Topic.Title: Already a miscarriage of justice in Zimermen case because of political considerations

Message.Msg: "... that's how it works, case closed, as far as this part. The main thing is he was processed through the system and not let go on his word alone..." There are a hundred cases across the nation with far more evidence that are not prosecuted each week, there are many cases for which there is far, far more evidence with "not guilty" verdicts each month. It's too bad the lesson was permanent for Trayvon, but the reality is this is NOT the way the system is supposed to work. The prosecution had no evidence close to removing reasonable doubt. In fact they had none to dispute Zimermen's version of events. Each witness they presented was one for the defense. Now you are left arguing the height of bushes. Too bad you didn't work for the prosecution, catching Zim in such a lie would have convicted him. This case was political because Trayvon could have been Obama's son in appearance. My hope is that no one is killed in the aftermath because we have a corrupt government that pretended there was a case to be made. Now "wrongful death" in a civil sense is a totally different animal, with different standards. My expectation was that that they would get a MS conviction on emotion alone so I am quite proud of the ladies who were mothers themselves, for weighing the facts.

Message.Title: Surface RT on Sale at Staples today for $349.00
Message.Msg: Surface RT Price Reduction at Staples = 349.00 This is the version that does not run all Windows programs. For 349.00 they also have the new Acer Icona W3 which is the first full powered Windows 8 tablet. You can run all Windows programs and it has an Intel Atom. This is the cheapest full powered Windows 8 tablet on the market. You can add a combo stand, keyboard & cover for 69.00. Downside on this is there is no touch pad. A blu tooth wireless can be added but that is another 70 bucks. Bye the way there is a separate touch mouse they call it from Microsoft for Surface etc that is nice. The new gen of machines will be rolling in starting this month. If you do not need a touch pad the Acer is a cheap price for a full power portable. The Surface pro is worlds above this machine though. That is 899.00. However, get ready for a price reduction soon just like the Surface RT which is 150.00 off. The one Staple I went to was throwing in a separate keyboard cover and that was 129 value. I think that may be an exception to the rule as that promo ended I believe. If not you can get the Surface RT for 150.0 off and a free keyboard worth 129.00. Nice.

Topic.Title: This is interesting - Microsoft to be run like Apple

Message.Msg: Quoting: "It appears Ballmer is trying to fit Microsoft into an Apple-shaped box. However, it is not clear if what worked for Jobs can simply be transferred to another company. Lashinsky cites Stanford business professor Charles O’Reilly who believes that, “the unusual way Jobs ran Apple would only work for him.” In other words, the essential ingredient in Apple’s formula for success may have been its one-of-a-kind CEO."
stock 0ver board! go l2!

Topic.Title: Already a miscarriage of justice in Zimermen case because of political considerations

Message.Msg: Prosecutors hate an engineer or nurse if they have no case, defendant hate them if they have no defense. Fact is there was no case. it is not the job of the defense to prove innocence and yet they came darn close with the evidence. It is the job of the prosecution to prove guilt and they did not remotely approach that level of proof. the travesty is that there was a trial. and ridiculous they asked for second degree. All that said is not to say Zimmerman was right or did not contribute, or that Trayvon should have died. that's too bad. You had apparent bad decisions by both resulting in a very bad outcome. That does not make murder, never close per the evidence. I know your racism and hatred is such that you want the burden of proof removed when the defendant is white, but that's not the way the law is supposed to work, such cases are not even supposed to be tri, and as this subject line indicates there should have been a directed acquittal from the judge.

Topic.Title: "they always get away" was used against Zimmerman

Message.Msg: ""but at that point Trayvon was far ahead of Zimmerman." Until Zimmerman Followed Him." And Zimmerman would have never caught up to him had Trayvon not loitered and doubled back, apparently to pick a fight. "If Zimmerman didn't follow like the dispatcher told him..." 43rd time for the illiterate liberal: There is no evidence he did not follow the dispatcher's instructions. HE WAS *ALREADY* FOLLOWING when the dispatcher told him that they didn't need for him to do that, he said he stopped. Here is something to grasp for you. Zimmerman may have followed, may have confronted Trayvon, may even have started the contact and still would not be guilty of murder. the case was a farce.

Message.Title: Hottest Play on Wall Street
Message.Msg: Big consolidation is occurring in the pay-TV industry and rumors are circulating that the #2 cable TV operator Time Warner Cable (TWC) may acquire the #5 operator Cablevision, which would bring them closer to #1 Comcast's subscriber base. Cable TV operators are now competing with telco TV companies like Verizon and OTT video companies like Netflix. Cable TV operators need to invest heavily into offering their subscribers new innovative technologies in order to keep their customers.. There is a low float, undiscovered and very undervalued stock that pioneered video on demand (VOD) with TWC a decade ago and is now pioneering a new technology that will revolutionize cable TV, Network DVR (nDVR). The company is Concurrent (CCUR) and it looks ready to soar to new 52-week highs this week. CCUR became the first company to introduce VOD to the market in 2000 when they deployed it with TWC and today, VOD is the fastest growing alternative TV platform in the world - with CCUR's VOD delivery technology reaching 50 million subscribers for a 30% global market share. 1/2 of all U.S. TV households now have a DVR, but CCUR is about to make today's DVR boxes obsolete with new cloud-based nDVRs. CCUR's nDVR technology is already powering TWC's extremely popular start-over and look-back features. Soon, CCUR will begin deploying fully featured nDVR services for its pay-TV clients. CCUR's nDVR technology will allow consumers to record unlimited television content to their account over the cloud, without a DVR box - and play it back on any device - including tablets and smartphones. CCUR finished last week at $7.88 with a market cap of only $68.98 million, cash of $22.37 million, and an enterprise value of $46.61 million or just 0.74X revenues and 6.54X cash flow from operations. CCUR's top rival SEAC is about to reach a new 52-week high and is trading for 1.78X revenues and 15.92X cash flow from operations. SEAC's valuation ratios would value CCUR around $15.50 per share!
